tool.name: OpenSwathChromatogramExtractor
tool.description: Extract chromatograms (XIC) from a MS2 map file.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && mkdir ${' '.join(["'in/%s'" % (i) for i, f in enumerate($in) if f])} && ${' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in/%s/%s.%s' && " % (f, i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(f.ext)) for i, f in enumerate($in) if f])} mkdir tr && ln -s '$tr' 'tr/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $tr.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($tr.ext)' && #if $rt_norm: mkdir rt_norm && ln -s '$rt_norm' 'rt_norm/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $rt_norm.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($rt_norm.ext)' && #end if mkdir out &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in ${' '.join(["'in/%s/%s.%s'"%(i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(f.ext)) for i, f in enumerate($in) if f])} -tr 'tr/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $tr.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($tr.ext)' #if $rt_norm: -rt_norm 'rt_norm/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $rt_norm.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($rt_norm.ext)' #end if -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' '$out' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: rt_norm
param.label: RT normalization file (how to map the RTs of this run to the ones stored in the library)

param.name: min_upper_edge_dist
param.label: Minimal distance to the edge to still consider a precursor, in Thomson

param.name: rt_window
param.label: Extraction window in RT dimension (-1 means extract over the whole range)
param.help: This is the full window size, e.g. a value of 1000 seconds would extract 500 seconds on either side

param.name: ion_mobility_window
param.label: Extraction window in ion mobility dimension (in milliseconds)
param.help: This is the full window size, e.g. a value of 10 milliseconds would extract 5 milliseconds on either side

param.name: mz_window
param.label: Extraction window in m/z dimension (in Thomson, to use ppm see -ppm flag)
param.help: This is the full window size, e.g. 100 ppm would extract 50 ppm on either side

param.name: is_swath
param.label: Set this flag if the data is SWATH data

param.name: extract_MS1
param.label: Extract the MS1 transitions based on the precursor values in the TraML file (useful for extracting MS1 XIC)

section.name: model
section.title: Options to control the modeling of retention time transformations from data

param.name: symmetric_regression
param.label: Only for 'linear' model: Perform linear regression on 'y - x' vs

param.name: extraction_function
param.label: Function used to extract the signal

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Extract chromatograms (XIC) from a MS2 map file.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/doxygen/release/2.6.0/html/TOPP_OpenSwathChromatogramExtractor.html
